content:
You are correct, I apologize for any confusion.
When I used the word "language" in my previous response, I used it in two different ways, one to refer to a set of concepts, grammar and vocabulary that make up a language and the other to refer to the means of communication, which is either spoken or written.

A more appropriate way to phrase it would be:
A writing system transcribes the concepts of a linguistic system into a written form and a spoken language transcribes the concepts of a linguistic system into spoken form.

Where "linguistic system" refers to the set of concepts, grammar, and vocabulary that make up a language and "written form" and "spoken form" refer to the means of communication, which is either written or spoken.

I apologize for any confusion that my previous answer might have caused.
